Posts.EditableText:
I am trying to install the quest app for google. I click your link and the app description pops up in a closeable dialog box but there is not an install button. I assume this is an editor. I want to be able to create html version of my text adventure but there seems no way to do this in the desktop version.
could I simply save your online editor to my desktop as html and run it offline?
Thanks,
Paul

Posts.EditableText: Simple! click on this link: http://textadventures.co.uk/quest See the green button on the right? It says "Add to Chrome" When you click that button you see a large dialog box that describes quest but nowhere is there an Install button to add it to Chrome.
Posts.HTML: Simple! click on this link: http://textadventures.co.uk/quest See the green button on the right? It says "Add to Chrome" When you click that button you see a large dialog box that describes quest but nowhere is there an Install button to add it to Chrome.

Posts.EditableText: Ah, I see. In my Firefox this button is not shown Ok, I checked it with Chrome and it seems to work. It adds a link to the Quest online editor. You must be logged in to work with it so you can't use it offline
Posts.HTML:
Ah, I see. In my Firefox this button is not shown
Ok, I checked it with Chrome and it seems to work. It adds a link to the Quest online editor. You must be logged in to work with it so you can't use it offline

Posts.EditableText: OK thanks! I figured it was something like that! Thanks for your help. I use chrome for my browser as Firefox is buggy for me and I only use it occasionally.
